title: "Le sucre: ami ou ennemi?" Post hiphop lettering
content:
Hello Typophiler,  
who writes like this/who started lettering like this? Do any script faces exist which come closer to this than Bello? Any posthiphop-script-type-art-historian around?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/script_6671.png)

Picture taken from: [http://lesucre-clothing.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936/http:/lesucre-clothing.com/ "http://lesucre-clothing.com")

+

 [‹ (x) "K-safe" condensed sans logo - Eurostile Cond {Akira Yoshino}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31872 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Asiago's Ristorante handwritten script logo - WSI Handscript {Angel} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31216 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Thorsten Geiger

comments.content:
Parra from Amsterdam !

He has done it for a couple of years (at least as far as I know)  
and has done a lot of work for the Rockwell clothing company [http://www.rockwellclothing.com/parra/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936/http:/www.rockwellclothing.com/parra/ "http://www.rockwellclothing.com/parra/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/imposter_5194.gif)
I adore Parra. He occupies a few of my iChat avatar slots.

kimou meyer - [www.grotesk.to](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936/http:/www.grotesk.to/ "www.grotesk.to")

i think its a bit different than what you are looking for in that its more influenced by handpainted signage/varsity stuff, but might have some interest to you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/04_Pigeon_League_4996.jpg)

thanks,  
Parra has to be on the list.  
nice board.

I think the ’script’ you are asking about is [ITC American Typewriter Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906201936/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-american-typewriter/).

- Mike Yanega
